cmsSystems.Name: WordPress
cmsSystems.Support: Open Source, Supported by most hosting companies
cmsSystems.Capabilities: Supports themes, supports plugins (50,000+), REST API, robust community support.
cmsSystems.Limitations: Security depends heavily on third-party plugins/themes, performance can degrade without caching, steep learning curve for developers.

cmsSystems.Name: Joomla!
cmsSystems.Capabilities: Built-in multilingual support, strong Access Control List (ACL) features, powerful for complex data structures and portals.
cmsSystems.Limitations: Less user-friendly than WordPress for beginners, fewer extensions compared to WordPress, major version upgrades can be complex.

cmsSystems.Name: Drupal
cmsSystems.Capabilities: Highly scalable and secure, excellent for enterprise-level applications and government sites, flexible content modeling (CCK).
cmsSystems.Limitations: Requires significant development knowledge, smallest community of the big three (WP, Joomla, Drupal), higher hosting requirements.

cmsSystems.Name: Shopify
cmsSystems.Capabilities: Fully managed hosting, integrated payment processing, excellent for e-commerce, simple setup and maintenance.
cmsSystems.Limitations: Monthly subscription fees, limited control over core code/server, customization is restricted by the platform's API.

cmsSystems.Name: Wix
cmsSystems.Capabilities: Drag-and-drop editor, zero-coding required for basic sites, extensive template library, integrated marketing tools.
cmsSystems.Limitations: Not easily transferable (site locked to Wix platform), performance can be suboptimal for large sites, free tier shows Wix ads.
